intro: Chlora intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate chlorine plant, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Chlora intermedia is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
